refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The following functions allow you to use a portable, fast and good pseudo-random number generator (PRNG). It uses the Mersenne Twister PRNG, which was originally developed by Makoto Matsumoto and Takuji Nishimura. Further information can be found at www.math.keio.ac.jp/~matumoto/emt.html.

If you just need a random number, you simply call the g_random_* functions, which will create a globally used GRand and use the according g_rand_* functions internally. Whenever you need a stream of reproducible random numbers, you better create a GRand yourself and use the g_rand_* functions directly, which will also be slightly faster. Initializing a GRand with a certain seed will produce exactly the same series of random numbers on all platforms. This can thus be used as a seed for e.g. games.
The g_rand*_range functions will return high quality equally distributed random numbers, whereas for example the (g_random_int()%max) approach often doesn't yield equally distributed numbers.

GLib changed the seeding algorithm for the pseudo-random number generator Mersenne Twister, as used by GRand and GRandom. This was necessary, because some seeds would yield very bad pseudo-random streams. Also the pseudo-random integers generated by g_rand*_int_range() will have a slightly better equal distribution with the new version of GLib.

The original seeding and generation algorithms, as found in GLib 2.0.x, can be used instead of the new ones by setting the environment variable G_RANDOM_VERSION to the value of '2.0'. Use the GLib-2.0 algorithms only if you have sequences of numbers generated with Glib-2.0 that you need to reproduce exactly.

refsect2.title: struct GRand
refsect2.para: The GRand struct is an opaque data structure. It should only be accessed through the g_rand_* functions.

refsect2.title: g_rand_new_with_seed ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new random number generator initialized with seed.

listitem.simpara: a value to initialize the random number generator.

refsect2.title: g_rand_new_with_seed_array ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new random number generator initialized with seed.

listitem.simpara: an array of seeds to initialize the random number generator.
an array of seeds to initialize the random number generator.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_rand_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new random number generator initialized with a seed taken either from /dev/urandom (if existing) or from the current time (as a fallback).

refsect2.title: g_rand_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copies a GRand into a new one with the same exact state as before. This way you can take a snapshot of the random number generator for replaying later.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_rand_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the memory allocated for the GRand.

refsect2.title: g_rand_set_seed ()
refsect2.para: Sets the seed for the random number generator GRand to seed.

listitem.simpara: a value to reinitialize the random number generator.

refsect2.title: g_rand_set_seed_array ()
refsect2.para: Initializes the random number generator by an array of longs. Array can be of arbitrary size, though only the first 624 values are taken. This function is useful if you have many low entropy seeds, or if you require more then 32bits of actual entropy for your application.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_rand_boolean()
refsect2.para: Returns a random gboolean from rand_. This corresponds to a unbiased coin toss.

refsect2.title: g_rand_int ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next random guint32 from rand_ equally distributed over the range [0..2^32-1].

refsect2.title: g_rand_int_range ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next random gint32 from rand_ equally distributed over the range [begin..end-1].

listitem.simpara: lower closed bound of the interval.
upper open bound of the interval.

refsect2.title: g_rand_double ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next random gdouble from rand_ equally distributed over the range [0..1).

refsect2.title: g_rand_double_range ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next random gdouble from rand_ equally distributed over the range [begin..end).

listitem.simpara: lower closed bound of the interval.
upper open bound of the interval.

refsect2.title: g_random_set_seed ()
refsect2.para: Sets the seed for the global random number generator, which is used by the g_random_* functions, to seed.

listitem.simpara: a value to reinitialize the global random number generator.
